Based on your preferences, I would recommend "The Deer Hunter" (1978) directed by Robert De Niro, and starring Christopher Walken.

In this powerful drama, Walken delivers a mesmerizing performance as an unemployed mechanic who spends most of his time in a bar called Trees Lounge in a small blue collar town. As the story unfolds, it becomes clear that this seemingly simple man is hiding a dark secret about his past.

As the plot progresses, Walken's performance becomes even more mesmerizing. From his initial hesitant delivery to his increasingly intense and emotionally charged delivery, Walken's performance is simply breathtaking.

In addition to Walken's mesmerizing performance, De Niro's direction and Christopher Walken's supporting role are also all worth noting and appreciating in this powerful drama.
